text.text:
★☆☆☆☆ Worst Hotel Experience Ever – Feels Like a Gutter

Avoid this place at all costs. The photos shown online are completely misleading — the actual condition of Hotel Grace Residency is disgusting and unsafe. The entire hotel feels like a gutter. Rooms and washrooms are in pathetic condition, and the staff behaves rudely and aggressively.

The place is filled with the smell of smoke, cigarette butts scattered everywhere, and zero cleanliness. Loud music and people shouting all night — it felt more like a shady club than a hotel. Absolutely not safe for families, kids, or even decent friends.

We regretted checking in the moment we arrived.
Scary, dirty, loud, unhygienic — a total nightmare.

NEVER STAY HERE. You’ve been warned.

text.text:
WARNING: DO NOT STAY HERE — THE WORST HOTEL EXPERIENCE OF MY LIFE

Let me be brutally honest — this place is a complete disaster. There is absolutely nothing redeeming about this property. From the moment you arrive, you're treated more like a suspect than a guest. Every time you enter, security guards make you write down your details in a logbook — like it’s some kind of prison. Why? No one can explain.

Now, let’s talk about the room. If you’re expecting anything close to the photos online, forget it. What they advertise as a "luxury 3-star hotel" is a complete joke. The room was filthy, run-down, and smelled awful. Honestly, I’ve seen public restrooms that were cleaner and more comfortable. The shower was broken, and the bathroom looked like it hadn’t been cleaned in weeks.

The experience only got worse at night. After 11 PM, they lock the main gates as if it’s a jail. You’re forced to show documents again, even if you’re already a checked-in guest. I was made to wait outside for 20 minutes arguing with the guards, despite explaining multiple times that I had already checked in and provided all necessary documents. The level of disrespect was unbelievable.

Staying at The Grace Residency was one of the worst decisions I’ve ever made while traveling. The name is completely misleading — there is no "grace," and certainly no "residency" worth staying in.

My advice? Stay far away. Don’t be fooled by the polished photos online — it’s all a scam. There are plenty of better places to stay that actually treat guests with basic respect and deliver what they promise. This isn’t one of them.

One more thing: even after booking through Booking.com, they called and demanded payment in advance to "confirm" the reservation — something that wasn’t mentioned on the site. This place is dirty, disorganized, and treats paying guests like intruders. No hospitality, no comfort, no vibe — just stress.

If this review is still up, consider yourself warned. I wouldn't wish this experience on anyone.

text.text:
My stay at The Grace Regency, Lucknow, was extremely disappointing from the moment I arrived.

First, there was an unnecessary long wait at check-in. Despite being on the 5th floor, I had to carry my own luggage as no staff offered help. Inside the lift, another guest/staff member was loudly abusing someone over the phone — very unprofessional atmosphere.

The hotel looks nothing like the pictures shown online. When I finally reached the floor, the staff hadn’t brought the room key and was busy on the phone, showing complete mismanagement and no coordination. I was left standing in the corridor for 20–25 minutes with my luggage before they opened the room.

Room condition:
•	Loose, damaged door locks — when I complained, staff didn’t fix it but instead showed me a “trick” to lock it. Seriously? I was staying alone — safety should be a priority, not a DIY hack.
•	Washroom tap dripping continuously — I complained 2 hours earlier and, out of frustration, even said, “Send the cleaning agents, I’ll fix it myself.” They simply replied, “No, ma’am.”
•	Pan masala packets left behind in the washroom — clear sign it was not cleaned properly
•	Bedsheet, quilt, and pillows were not clean
•	Landline phone not working
•	Low battery in TV remote — when I informed staff, they casually told me to use the AC remote batteries instead. I told them my mind works and I had already done that before even calling.

Amenities:
•	Only small bottles of shampoo, bath wash, a paper roll, and possibly handwash in the bathroom
•	In the kitchen: kettle, 2 sugar sachets, 2 milk powder sachets, 2 tea bags, 2 glasses, and 1 cup with tray
•	Refrigerator was fine, no dripping
•	No hair dryer provided despite being listed
•	Charged ₹10 extra per water bottle (over MRP)
•	Charged ₹50 extra for a dental kit which was supposed to be included in amenities

The only positive point — the first pantry staff member I interacted with was polite and professional. After that, the rest? Complete silence — either indifferent or unresponsive.

Overall, the hygiene was poor, staff service was careless, safety was compromised, and management seemed completely unorganized. Definitely not worth the money, and I would not recommend this place to anyone looking for a safe, comfortable, or professional stay.

⭐ Rating: 1/5

text.text:
Extremely Disappointing Experience – A Month of Repeated Negligence

I have been staying at this property for over a month now, and unfortunately, the experience has been nothing short of frustrating and disappointing. Despite raising several concerns through multiple calls and reminders, there has been no meaningful action taken by the management.

To begin with, the condition of the room furniture is not only poor but outright hazardous. One of our team members sustained a cut from an exposed iron plate on a piece of furniture — a serious safety issue that was neither acknowledged nor addressed. This level of negligence is unacceptable, especially when guests’ well-being is at risk.

The breakfast menu is monotonous and lacks any variety. Every single day, it consists of the same items — poha and puri bhaji. There has been absolutely no effort to introduce any changes or improvements, which reflects poorly on the service quality and attention to guest satisfaction.

Housekeeping is another major concern. Room cleaning is routinely done after 5 PM, which is highly inconvenient. On several occasions, the rooms were not cleaned at all, with no explanation or apology offered.

The bathroom conditions are equally dismal. The water in the flush is visibly dirty, and there's no designated space to place soap or toiletries while bathing. Basic amenities that one expects from any hotel are simply missing here.

Additionally, the infrastructure is in a state of disrepair. Many doors are broken or damaged, and the door knobs are so tight they are difficult to operate, adding to daily inconvenience.

Overall, the stay has been a difficult and unpleasant experience due to the consistent lack of upkeep, poor hygiene standards, and an unresponsive management. These are fundamental issues that cannot be overlooked.

text.text:
Experience from 8 July to 12 July 2025 (Premium Room with Lunch+Dinner Booked from MMT)
1. They tried to give me delux room(140sq.ft), even though I had booked premium room(198sq.ft). Fortunately I had seen the pictures of room in MMT and demanded the same room to be alloted that displayed in site.
2. Breakfast is ok. Dinner is absolutely worst.
3. Dinner is same every day and they have fix option. I ate same dinner for 3 days. You had to wait 1hr atleast (20mins for soup & 40mins for main course) to get your dinner served because the staff gives priority to serving others who doesn't include dinner in the hotel package and have seperate dinner.
4. Dinner/Breakfast hall is also not very clean. There are untidy counters, storage items, mosquitos, flies etc.
5. Room service takes 45min to bring one water bottle.
6. Construction noise in hotel will be intolerable in the noon.

text.text:
Excellent Stay with Great Service!
We had a fantastic experience at The Kingship by Kahlon, Lucknow. From the moment we arrived, everything was smooth and hassle-free. The check-in and check-out process was seamless, thanks to Mr. Abhishek, who was extremely helpful and ensured a comfortable stay.

The room was impeccably clean, well-maintained, and to my delight, I even received an upgrade—which was truly the cherry on top! The hospitality, attention to detail, and overall ambiance made my stay very enjoyable.

Highly recommended for anyone looking for a comfortable and pleasant stay in Lucknow. Looking forward to visiting again!

I had a pleasant stay at Hotel Mellnia Residency. The rooms were clean and well-maintained, offering a comfortable and peaceful environment. The front office manager and the front office staff were especially excellent — very polite, professional, and always ready to help with a smile.

Though there were a few delays in service at times, the team made sure all requests were fulfilled properly. The location of the hotel is also convenient, with easy access to nearby shops and restaurants.

Overall, it's a decent place for a short stay, and with a little improvement in service speed, it can be an even better experience. Good value for money.

text.text:
I checked in today for a two-night stay in their suite with a bathtub. My flight landed at 7 AM, and I had already spoken to the hotel beforehand requesting an early check-in. Unfortunately, despite the room being vacant, we were made to wait two hours before being given the keys. I understand hotel policies may not allow early check-in more than four hours before standard time, but what was disappointing was that even during those two hours in the lobby, it took them an hour just to serve us a glass of water.

The suite itself is spacious, with two bathrooms, a sitting area, and a bedroom. However, I learned that the property is 15 years old, and it shows. The room has wooden paneling on all walls, but the storage space is limited—just one cupboard, which is inadequate for even two people. The mattress was slightly smaller than the bed, affecting the aesthetics. The room had a musty smell, like it hadn’t been aired out in a while. The bathroom is large with a bathtub, but the fittings, mirror, and toilet look old and in need of replacement. There was no hot water during my first day. The French windows in both the bedroom and sitting area have visible water stains, which affect the view. Outside the room, the passageway has water dripping from the roof, possibly from AC vents.

I requested a room freshener to deal with the musty smell, but it never arrived. The reception staff were polite but not particularly warm—everything was handled in a matter-of-fact way without much hospitality.

On the positive side, the location is excellent—right in the Hazratganj area, close to all major tourist spots in Lucknow. I’ve only stayed one night so far, so let’s see how tomorrow goes.

text.text:
Great location and well-designed rooms — the bathrooms were clean and had all the essentials. That’s where the good part ends.

The staff was rude and completely unwelcoming, which really ruined the experience.From the moment we checked in, there was this coldness — no warmth, no sense of hospitality. It genuinely felt like they were doing us a favour by letting us stay there. On top of that, there were frequent power cuts, and no one seemed bothered or apologetic about it.

For the price and reputation, I expected basic courtesy and smoother service. Disappointed.
It’s frustrating because the property has potential. But if you're looking for a pleasant, smooth, and welcoming experience — I’d suggest looking elsewhere unless they seriously work on their service and basic infrastructure.

It genuinely felt like they were doing us a favour by letting us stay there. On top of that, there were frequent power cuts, and no one seemed bothered or apologetic about it.

For the price and reputation, I expected basic courtesy and smoother service. Disappointed.
It’s frustrating because the property has potential. But if you're looking for a pleasant, smooth, and welcoming experience — I’d suggest looking elsewhere unless they seriously work on their service and basic infrastructure.

text.text:
I am writing to express my disappointment with my recent experience at Regenta Central Lucknow, which marks the second time I have felt let down by your services.
During this stay, I faced significant inconvenience due to non-functional air conditioning. Despite changing rooms three times, I was not provided a room with a properly working AC:

Room 4115 – AC was completely non-functional.

Room 4114 – AC not cooling, no fridge, broken mirror, faulty flush, and several non-working lights.

Room 4112 – AC worked for about 2 hours and then stopped cooling altogether.

While the staff was courteous and tried to be supportive, they were unable to resolve the issue. I now understand why each room has a ceiling fan — seemingly to compensate for malfunctioning AC units, which is not expected at this price point or standard of service.

This follows an earlier disappointing experience:
Last year, I had to cancel my booking due to a sudden family emergency. I had informed the management in good faith and was verbally assured a credit for a future stay, with no terms discussed at the time. However, when I reached out 10 months later to utilize that credit, I was told that the credit validity was only 3 months — a condition that was never communicated earlier. Despite multiple requests, not even a complimentary meal was offered as a goodwill gesture.

Both experiences reflect poorly on guest service and post-booking support. I hope you will take this feedback seriously and work toward improving both the maintenance of your property and transparency in guest communication.

text.text:
I recently stayed at Regenta Central, Lucknow, and while I truly appreciated the hospitality and responsiveness of the staff, I feel compelled to point out some issues that need urgent attention.

We had booked the **Royal Suite**, but unfortunately, the **AC wasn’t working**. I requested the staff to look into it, and they tried their best, but eventually had to **shift us to another room**. The new room was quite nice, with good interiors and overall ambiance — but the **AC again was not up to the mark**.

Additionally, **hot water wasn’t available in the tap**, and even after waiting for a long time, it didn’t work properly. While we visited in the summer, I can only imagine how inconvenient this would be in winter.

Again, I want to **emphasize that the staff was very courteous and helpful** — they are doing a commendable job with the resources available to them. The issues seem to be related to **infrastructure and maintenance**, which I hope the hotel management or higher authorities will address soon.

This place has great potential, but it urgently needs **renovation and better facilities** to truly offer a comfortable experience.

The staff’s rudeness and unwillingness to understand is another jewel in their crown.
DEFINITELY WOULD NOT RECOMMEND.

I had a very bad experience at Vint Club Resort in Lucknow. They allowed me to check in at 4 PM but asked me to check out by 10 AM the next morning, which was extremely inconvenient. The bathroom didn’t have basic toiletries like shower gel or shampoo — something you’d expect at any decent hotel.

They even charged extra just for a bucket of ice, which felt unreasonable. But the worst part was the loud DJ music playing outside, which continued late into the night. I couldn’t sleep at all because of the noise.

Overall, it was the worst hotel experience I’ve had. Not recommended at all.

text.text:
Extremely Unprofessional and Serious Privacy Violation!

I had a terrible experience at Hotel La Maison. I extended my stay on 21st February and informed the reception at 10 AM, which was acknowledged. However, at 12 PM, a staff member named Aman asked if I was staying or checking out, despite my prior confirmation. Shockingly, at 3 PM, he aggressively tried to open my door using a master key, even when I was inside and clearly told him not to. If my door hadn’t been locked from inside, this could have been a serious breach of privacy and security.

When I reported this to the reception, instead of addressing the issue, the staff laughed in front of the manager. This kind of unprofessionalism and lack of respect for guests is completely unacceptable. I strongly advise against staying here

text.text:
Kingship By Kahlon in Lucknow stands out as a well-rated, modern hotel that consistently impresses guests with its blend of comfort, service, and value. Located conveniently on Rae Bareli Road in Vrindavan Yojana, the hotel is close to major landmarks like SGPGI Hospital, making it an ideal choice for both business and leisure traveler.

The property features 35 rooms equipped with contemporary amenities such as air conditioning, flat-screen TVs, blackout curtains, and soundproofing, ensuring a restful stay. Guests frequently praise the cleanliness and maintenance of both rooms and bathrooms, highlighting the hotel’s commitment to hygiene and safety. The ambience is described as elegant and peaceful, with a city view adding to the overall experience.

Service is a major highlight at Kingship By Kahlon. The staff is noted for being exceptionally polite, helpful, and responsive, often going out of their way to accommodate special requests or resolve issues promptly. The hotel’s restaurant, Cilantrro, receives high marks for its delicious food, especially the breakfast buffet and signature dishes like biryani and pizzas from a traditional Italian oven. Complimentary hi-tea and discounts on food and laundry add extra value to the stay.

Amenities such as free high-speed WiFi, ample parking, conference and banquet facilities, and 24-hour security cater to a wide range of guest needs. The hotel’s location is also appreciated for its proximity to shopping malls, tourist attractions, and transport hubs, while still offering a quiet, safe environment.

While a few guests mention minor issues like occasional delays in housekeeping or slightly compact rooms, the overall consensus is overwhelmingly positive. Kingship By Kahlon is highly recommended for its excellent hospitality, modern comforts, and great value for money, making it a top choice among Lucknow’s boutique hotels.

text.text:
I’ve been visiting Lucknow-“The city of Nawabs” for couple of months now for my official work. As a first time visitor to the city, I was apprehensive in getting a good property to stay upon, but with the help of friendly references I visited Hotel Syona & appreciated my decision to stay there. Right from the main entrance where a guest  is greeted with a smile, their hard working front desk people are always ready to assist you. Be it a check in/out, room assistance etc.The rooms are spacious with good ambience & reasonably priced. The property has an in-house kitchen which serves good & hygienic food(though a bit costly) Room service is prompt. Moreover , it’s conveniently located behind the Charbagh bus stand & a walking distance from Lucknow railway station.Metro is just a hand away from the property. The major attractions of Lucknow are easily accessible from the hotel.
Kudos to the management & Mr Dharmendra Pathak(GM) for their continuous efforts to improvise the client satisfaction.

text.text:
Located in one of the most prominent locations of Lucknow, this place is perfect for your staycations and getaways.

I recently visited The Nest and opted for their Dojo Room on 8th floor which has anime theme. This room also comes up with an XBox at extra charges. The Xbox charges are very nominal.
The staff is really good and cooperative. They have parking, 24*7, check in and check out facility, fridge, microwave, induction, AC, cupboard, sofa, double bed.
The washroom was very clean and hygienic. The cleaners used to deep clean the room, bathroom and utensils daily.

This room comes with a gorgeous balcony view with chairs available for you to sit and relax. They have various restaurants, cafes, pub, bars, local grocery stores nearby.

They also have various other rooms with different themes as well. The best place to stay in Lucknow. Would highly recommend this place.

text.text:
Review for Hotel Regenta

Hotel Regenta offers a promising stay with several commendable aspects, but a few notable drawbacks affect the overall experience. Here’s an elaborate review based on my stay:

Positives:

1. Staff and Service:
The staff stands out for their courtesy, responsiveness, and professionalism. Their polite demeanor and quick responses to issues add a personal touch to the overall experience, making guests feel valued.

2. Rooms and Amenities:
The rooms are spacious and comfortable, providing a good environment for relaxation. However, some aspects of the room facilities could be improved for a seamless experience.

3. Location:
The hotel is ideally located near some renowned food joints, making it a haven for food lovers. From Royal Cafe to Sardarji Cholewale, Shukla Chat, and Sambar Anna, there’s an abundance of culinary options. A special mention goes to the Indori Poha stall opposite Shukla Chat, which is a must-try for guests.

Negatives:

1. Cleanliness:
The cleanliness of the room was subpar upon check-in. Finding hairs on the bed sheet was disappointing, though the housekeeping staff promptly replaced it upon request. Such issues should ideally be addressed before a guest arrives to ensure a pleasant first impression.

2. Maintenance:
The television was non-operational until later in the night, as it required a recharge. This minor inconvenience could have been avoided with a pre-check before guest arrival. Additionally, water leakage from the bathroom into the bedroom posed a significant issue. It was only noticed after using the bathroom, which could be inconvenient and uncomfortable for guests.

Overall Experience:
While the hotel scores high on staff behavior, location, and room size, the lapses in cleanliness, maintenance, and bathroom functionality diminish the overall experience. With better attention to detail and proactive measures, these issues could easily be resolved.

Rating:
Given the mix of positives and negatives, the hotel earns a 3.5/5 rating. It has great potential, but addressing these concerns is crucial to enhancing guest satisfaction and achieving a perfect score.

The receptionist created a blunder in the booking procedure we booked via online app when we showed up the next day (the night I was having a flight) they said the rooms are full though we reached on the proper check in time and the payment was already done, not just us several other students who were having an exam next day faced the same issue they chose this hotel since it is located near to their respective exam centre at last moment the requested us to shift to another location and where we all were in a denial they even refused to payback they said us to wait for the app refund which wasn't possible since the cancellation time was already up!

I've stayed here earlier too, regarding that I would like to say the rooms are clean and hygienic the food is good, the staff are good as well!
